elements.title: the Freshies (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 2019 South Carolina Gamecocks women's basketball recruiting class (pictured) is known as the Freshies after the name of the group chat they created before their freshman year?

elements.title: a Las Vegas TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 1956, a Las Vegas TV station may have been the only 24-hour TV station in the U.S.?

elements.title: a photograph (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a photograph inspired by one of Leonardo da Vinci's paintings shows 14 Israeli soldiers and was described as a "homoerotic challenge to Israeli machismo"?

elements.title: Rain on the Roof (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that John Sebastian composed the song "Rain on the Roof" after he spent a night listening to the rain with his wife?

elements.title: Satrio Sastrodiredjo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Satrio Sastrodiredjo and Moerachman, both former mayors of Surabaya, Indonesia, were held as political prisoners in the same prison after the 30 September Movement in 1965?

elements.title: Pacifying the Homeland (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 2019 book Pacifying the Homeland was compared to an ice-cold shower for individuals acclimatized to mass surveillance in the US due to its pervasiveness in daily life?

elements.title: Anthony Pople (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 1994, Anthony Pople created two computer programs to analyse classical music?

elements.title: Made With Lau (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Cantonese cooking channel Made With Lau began generating about US$50,000 per month in YouTube advertising revenue in under a year?
